result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela Marie Bryant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor), Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor), Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case including mandatory costs and sucharges and pay Supervision fees as determined by the DOC. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

Obtain GED/ HSED.
Obtain and maintain employment.

NO firearms/ weapons.
Due to this DV conviction, defendant may never possess firearms or ammunition.

NO CONTACT with victim UNLESS the victim requests contact, AND THEN ONLY AFTER the Court has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.   Defendant advised of penalties for violation of No Contact Order.

Successfully complete:
- BIP counseling.
-Mental Health evaluation and take ALL prescribed medications, and/ or any treatment deemed appopriate.
-Any other counseling and/ or treatment deemed appropriate.

Participate in AODA assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; random urine screens & breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending Probation review on 09-05-14 at 1:30 p.m.
***11/7/14, Judge Dallet, Court ordered defendant to serve 80 days straight time, with no good time credit, as condition time in the House of Correction for said defendant's non-compliance with aforementioned condition of probation.***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angela Marie Bryant

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angela Marie Bryant not in court.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 80 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Angela Marie Bryant in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Angela Marie Bryant in court with attorney Jane H Christopherson.  Ryan T Sanson for Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 116 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
*
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 40 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/05/14.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random breathalyzer and urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  The 5/27/14 jury trial is vacated.

Defendant Angela Marie Bryant in court with attorney Jane H Christopherson.  Defendant Angela Marie Bryant in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to COUNT 1:  Battery, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 939.63(1)(a), 968.075(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor and COUNT 2:  Disorderly Conduct, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 939.63(1)(a), 968.075(1)(a), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 05-06-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jane H Christopherson in court, defendant Angela Marie Bryant not in court, in custody.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of today's hearing and requests adjournment for further final pre-trial.  Court orders case adjourned for further final pre-trial in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Angela Marie Bryant not in court, in custody.  Molly Marie Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jane Christopherson in court, defendant Angela Marie Bryant not in court, in custody.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for scheduling conference.  Defense counsel would like a little more time to review discovery with the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing  FEBRUARY 17, 2014  received and filed. (17 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Jane Christopherson - SPD.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 40 on 2-25-2014 at 8:30am for Scheduling Conference.

Defendant Angela Marie Bryant in court with attorney Jane Christopherson.  Defendant Angela Marie Bryant in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case heard for Branch 40.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court orders sequestration of witnesses.  Sworn for the State: PO Troy Hopgood(MPD); PO Jay Ehlers(MPD).
State rests.  Defense rests.
Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.
Due to the assignment of Assistant District Attorney Molly Schmidt, case is reassigned to Judge Dallet.  Case is transferred forthwith to branch 40 for Preliminary Hearing.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jerry L

Defendant Angela Marie Bryant in court with attorney Dawn Rablin.  Defendant Angela Marie Bryant in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
